trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager Overview
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager Overview

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use Azure Resource Manager for deployment, management, and access control of resources on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use Azure Resource Manager for deployment, management, and access control of resources on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager Overview
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager Overview

trans-unit.source: Applications are typically made up of many components – maybe a web app, database, database server, storage, and 3rd party services.
trans-unit.target: Applications are typically made up of many components – maybe a web app, database, database server, storage, and 3rd party services.

trans-unit.source: You do not see these components as separate entities, instead you see them as related and interdependent parts of a single entity.
trans-unit.target: You do not see these components as separate entities, instead you see them as related and interdependent parts of a single entity.

trans-unit.source: You want to deploy, manage, and monitor them as a group.
trans-unit.target: You want to deploy, manage, and monitor them as a group.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy, update or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy, update or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.

trans-unit.source: You use a template for deployment and that template can work for different environments such as testing, staging and production.
trans-unit.target: You use a template for deployment and that template can work for different environments such as testing, staging and production.

trans-unit.source: You can clarify billing for your organization by viewing the rolled-up costs for the entire group.
trans-unit.target: You can clarify billing for your organization by viewing the rolled-up costs for the entire group.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager natively integrates access control into the management platform so you can specify which actions a user in your organization can take for a resource group.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager natively integrates access control into the management platform so you can specify which actions a user in your organization can take for a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Resource Manager provides a new way to deploy and manage your solutions.
trans-unit.target: Resource Manager provides a new way to deploy and manage your solutions.

trans-unit.source: To learn about the changes in this new deployment model, see [Understanding Resource Manager deployment and classic deployment](resource-manager-deployment-model.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn about the changes in this new deployment model, see [Understanding Resource Manager deployment and classic deployment](resource-manager-deployment-model.md).

trans-unit.source: Here's a video demonstration of this overview:
trans-unit.target: Here's a video demonstration of this overview:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This topic describes resources, groups, and templates using the preview portal to demonstrate the concepts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This topic describes resources, groups, and templates using the preview portal to demonstrate the concepts.

trans-unit.source: However, you can also create, manage, and delete Azure resources using the [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows](virtual-machines/xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md) as well as [PowerShell](powershell-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: However, you can also create, manage, and delete Azure resources using the [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows](virtual-machines/xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md) as well as [PowerShell](powershell-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: Resource Groups
trans-unit.target: Resource Groups

trans-unit.source: A resource group is a container that holds related resources for an application.
trans-unit.target: A resource group is a container that holds related resources for an application.

trans-unit.source: The resource group could include all of the resources for an application, or only those resources that are logically grouped together.
trans-unit.target: The resource group could include all of the resources for an application, or only those resources that are logically grouped together.

trans-unit.source: You can decide how you want to allocate resources to resource groups based on what makes the most sense for your organization.
trans-unit.target: You can decide how you want to allocate resources to resource groups based on what makes the most sense for your organization.

trans-unit.source: There are some important factors to consider when defining your resource group:
trans-unit.target: There are some important factors to consider when defining your resource group:

trans-unit.source: All of the resources in your group must share the same lifecycle.
trans-unit.target: All of the resources in your group must share the same lifecycle.

trans-unit.source: You will deploy, update and delete them together.
trans-unit.target: You will deploy, update and delete them together.

trans-unit.source: If one resource, such as a database server, needs to exist on a different deployment cycle it should be in another resource group.
trans-unit.target: If one resource, such as a database server, needs to exist on a different deployment cycle it should be in another resource group.

trans-unit.source: Each resource can only exist in one resource group.
trans-unit.target: Each resource can only exist in one resource group.

trans-unit.source: You can add or remove a resource to a resource group at any time.
trans-unit.target: You can add or remove a resource to a resource group at any time.

trans-unit.source: A resource group can contain resources that reside in different regions.
trans-unit.target: A resource group can contain resources that reside in different regions.

trans-unit.source: A resource group can be used to scope access control for administrative actions.
trans-unit.target: A resource group can be used to scope access control for administrative actions.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal, all new resources are created in a resource group.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal, all new resources are created in a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Even if you create just a single resource such as a web site, you must decide whether to add that resource to an existing group or create a new group for that resource.
trans-unit.target: Even if you create just a single resource such as a web site, you must decide whether to add that resource to an existing group or create a new group for that resource.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows a resource group with Application Insights, database server, database, app service plan, and web site.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows a resource group with Application Insights, database server, database, app service plan, and web site.

trans-unit.source: resource group summary
trans-unit.target: resource group summary

trans-unit.source: A resource group can also be linked to a resource in another resource group.
trans-unit.target: A resource group can also be linked to a resource in another resource group.

trans-unit.source: A resource is considered linked when a deployment dependency exists between resources in different resource groups.
trans-unit.target: A resource is considered linked when a deployment dependency exists between resources in different resource groups.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a web app in one resource group connects to database in another resource group, those resources are linked.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a web app in one resource group connects to database in another resource group, those resources are linked.

trans-unit.source: You can also explicitly define links between resources in other resource group.
trans-unit.target: You can also explicitly define links between resources in other resource group.

trans-unit.source: For more information about linking resources, see [Linking resources in Azure Resource Manager](resource-group-link-resources.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information about linking resources, see [Linking resources in Azure Resource Manager](resource-group-link-resources.md)

trans-unit.source: If you need to move a resource to a new resource group, see [Move resources to new resource group or subscription](resource-group-move-resources.md).
trans-unit.target: If you need to move a resource to a new resource group, see [Move resources to new resource group or subscription](resource-group-move-resources.md).

trans-unit.source: From the preview portal, you can easily view costs, monitor events, and manage alerts.
trans-unit.target: From the preview portal, you can easily view costs, monitor events, and manage alerts.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows the consolidated billing for a group.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows the consolidated billing for a group.

trans-unit.source: billing
trans-unit.target: billing

trans-unit.source: Template Deployment
trans-unit.target: Template Deployment

trans-unit.source: With Azure Resource Manager, you can create a simple template (in JSON format) that defines deployment and configuration of your application.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Resource Manager, you can create a simple template (in JSON format) that defines deployment and configuration of your application.

trans-unit.source: This template in known as an Azure Template and provides a declarative way to define deployment.
trans-unit.target: This template in known as an Azure Template and provides a declarative way to define deployment.

trans-unit.source: By using a template, you can repeatedly deploy your application throughout the app lifecycle and have confidence your resources are deployed in a consistent state.
trans-unit.target: By using a template, you can repeatedly deploy your application throughout the app lifecycle and have confidence your resources are deployed in a consistent state.

trans-unit.source: Within the template, you define the infrastructure for your app, how to configure that infrastructure, and how to publish your app code to that infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Within the template, you define the infrastructure for your app, how to configure that infrastructure, and how to publish your app code to that infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to worry about the order for deployment because Azure Resource Manager analyzes dependencies to ensure resources are created in the correct order.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to worry about the order for deployment because Azure Resource Manager analyzes dependencies to ensure resources are created in the correct order.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the template for updates to the infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the template for updates to the infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can add a new resource to your app and add configuration rules for the resources that are already deployed.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can add a new resource to your app and add configuration rules for the resources that are already deployed.

trans-unit.source: If the template specifies creating a new resource but that resource already exists, Azure Resource Manager performs an update instead of creating a new asset.
trans-unit.target: If the template specifies creating a new resource but that resource already exists, Azure Resource Manager performs an update instead of creating a new asset.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager updates the existing asset to the same state as it would be as new.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager updates the existing asset to the same state as it would be as new.

trans-unit.source: You can specify parameters in your template to allow for customization and flexibility in deployment.
trans-unit.target: You can specify parameters in your template to allow for customization and flexibility in deployment.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can pass parameter values that tailor deployment for your test environment.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can pass parameter values that tailor deployment for your test environment.

trans-unit.source: By specifying the parameters, you can use the same template for deployment to all of your app’s environments.
trans-unit.target: By specifying the parameters, you can use the same template for deployment to all of your app’s environments.

trans-unit.source: You can perform all required steps for deployment and configuration through the template and you should not have any remaining manual steps.
trans-unit.target: You can perform all required steps for deployment and configuration through the template and you should not have any remaining manual steps.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager provides extensions for scenarios when you need additional operations such as installing particular software that is not included in the setup.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager provides extensions for scenarios when you need additional operations such as installing particular software that is not included in the setup.

trans-unit.source: If you are already using a configuration management service, like DSC, Chef or Puppet, you can continue working with that service by using extensions.
trans-unit.target: If you are already using a configuration management service, like DSC, Chef or Puppet, you can continue working with that service by using extensions.

trans-unit.source: When you create a solution from the Marketplace, the solution automatically includes a deployment template.
trans-unit.target: When you create a solution from the Marketplace, the solution automatically includes a deployment template.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to create your template from scratch because you can start with the template for your solution and customize it to meet your specific needs.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to create your template from scratch because you can start with the template for your solution and customize it to meet your specific needs.

trans-unit.source: Finally, the template becomes part of the source code for your app.
trans-unit.target: Finally, the template becomes part of the source code for your app.

trans-unit.source: You can check it in to your source code repository and update it as your app evolves.
trans-unit.target: You can check it in to your source code repository and update it as your app evolves.

trans-unit.source: You can edit the template through Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can edit the template through Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: For more information about defining the template, see [Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates](./resource-group-authoring-templates.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about defining the template, see [Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates](./resource-group-authoring-templates.md).

trans-unit.source: For template schemas, see [Azure Resource Manager Schemas](https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-schemas).
trans-unit.target: For template schemas, see [Azure Resource Manager Schemas](https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-schemas).

trans-unit.source: For information about using a template for deployment, see [Deploy an application with Azure Resource Manager template](azure-portal/resource-group-template-deploy.md) and [Deploy a complex application predictably in Azure](app-service-web/app-service-deploy-complex-application-predictably.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about using a template for deployment, see [Deploy an application with Azure Resource Manager template](azure-portal/resource-group-template-deploy.md) and [Deploy a complex application predictably in Azure](app-service-web/app-service-deploy-complex-application-predictably.md).

trans-unit.source: For guidance about how to structure your templates, see [Best practices for designing Azure Resource Manager templates](best-practices-resource-manager-design-templates.md).
trans-unit.target: For guidance about how to structure your templates, see [Best practices for designing Azure Resource Manager templates](best-practices-resource-manager-design-templates.md).

trans-unit.source: Tags
trans-unit.target: Tags

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager provides a tagging feature that enables you to categorize resources according to your requirements for managing or billing.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager provides a tagging feature that enables you to categorize resources according to your requirements for managing or billing.

trans-unit.source: You might want to use tags when you have a complex collection of resource groups and resources, and need to visualize those assets in the way that makes the most sense to you.
trans-unit.target: You might want to use tags when you have a complex collection of resource groups and resources, and need to visualize those assets in the way that makes the most sense to you.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could tag resources that serve a similar role in your organization or belong to the same department.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could tag resources that serve a similar role in your organization or belong to the same department.

trans-unit.source: In the preview portal, you can start working with tags by clicking on the tag icon.
trans-unit.target: In the preview portal, you can start working with tags by clicking on the tag icon.

trans-unit.source: tags
trans-unit.target: tags

trans-unit.source: Resources do not need to reside in the same resource group to share a tag.
trans-unit.target: Resources do not need to reside in the same resource group to share a tag.

trans-unit.source: You can create your own tag taxonomy to ensure that all users in your organization use common tags rather than users inadvertently applying slightly different tags (such as "dept" instead of "department").
trans-unit.target: You can create your own tag taxonomy to ensure that all users in your organization use common tags rather than users inadvertently applying slightly different tags (such as "dept" instead of "department").

trans-unit.source: For more information about tags, see [Using tags to organize your Azure resources](./resource-group-using-tags.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about tags, see [Using tags to organize your Azure resources](./resource-group-using-tags.md).

trans-unit.source: Access Control
trans-unit.target: Access Control

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager enables you to control who has access to specific actions for your organization.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager enables you to control who has access to specific actions for your organization.

trans-unit.source: It natively integrates OAuth and Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) into the management platform and applies that access control to all services in your resource group.
trans-unit.target: It natively integrates OAuth and Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) into the management platform and applies that access control to all services in your resource group.

trans-unit.source: You can add users to pre-defined platform and resource-specific roles and apply those roles to a subscription, resource group or resource to limit access.
trans-unit.target: You can add users to pre-defined platform and resource-specific roles and apply those roles to a subscription, resource group or resource to limit access.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can take advantage of the pre-defined role called SQL DB Contributor that permits users to manage databases, but not database servers or security policies.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can take advantage of the pre-defined role called SQL DB Contributor that permits users to manage databases, but not database servers or security policies.

trans-unit.source: You add users in your organization that need this type of access to the SQL DB Contributor role and apply the role to the subscription, resource group or resource.
trans-unit.target: You add users in your organization that need this type of access to the SQL DB Contributor role and apply the role to the subscription, resource group or resource.

trans-unit.source: In the preview portal, you can define access control by clicking on the access button.
trans-unit.target: In the preview portal, you can define access control by clicking on the access button.

trans-unit.source: user access control
trans-unit.target: user access control

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager automatically logs user actions for auditing.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager automatically logs user actions for auditing.

trans-unit.source: You can also explicitly lock critical resources to prevent users from deleting or modifying them.
trans-unit.target: You can also explicitly lock critical resources to prevent users from deleting or modifying them.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Lock resources with Azure Resource Manager](resource-group-lock-resources.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Lock resources with Azure Resource Manager](resource-group-lock-resources.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information about role-based access control, see [Role-based access control in the Microsoft Azure preview portal](./role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role-based access control, see [Role-based access control in the Microsoft Azure preview portal](./role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: For examples of setting access policies, see [Managing and Auditing Access to Resources](azure-portal/resource-group-rbac.md).
trans-unit.target: For examples of setting access policies, see [Managing and Auditing Access to Resources](azure-portal/resource-group-rbac.md).

trans-unit.source: For best practices, see [Security considerations for Azure Resource Manager](best-practices-resource-manager-security.md)
trans-unit.target: For best practices, see [Security considerations for Azure Resource Manager](best-practices-resource-manager-security.md)

trans-unit.source: Consistent Management Layer
trans-unit.target: Consistent Management Layer

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager provides completely compatible operations through Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows, the Azure portal, or REST API.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager provides completely compatible operations through Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows, the Azure portal, or REST API.

trans-unit.source: You can use the interface that works best for you, and move quickly between the interfaces without confusion.
trans-unit.target: You can use the interface that works best for you, and move quickly between the interfaces without confusion.

trans-unit.source: The portal even displays notification for actions taken outside of the portal.
trans-unit.target: The portal even displays notification for actions taken outside of the portal.

trans-unit.source: For information about PowerShell, see [Using Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager](./powershell-azure-resource-manager.md) and [Azure Resource Manager Cmdlets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn757692.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For information about PowerShell, see [Using Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager](./powershell-azure-resource-manager.md) and [Azure Resource Manager Cmdlets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn757692.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For information about Azure CLI, see [Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Management](./virtual-machines/xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about Azure CLI, see [Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Management](./virtual-machines/xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: For information about the REST API, see [Azure Resource Manager REST API Reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For information about the REST API, see [Azure Resource Manager REST API Reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For information about using the preview portal, see [Using the Azure Preview Portal to manage your Azure resources](azure-portal/resource-group-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about using the preview portal, see [Using the Azure Preview Portal to manage your Azure resources](azure-portal/resource-group-portal.md).

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: To learn about creating templates, see [Authoring templates](./resource-group-authoring-templates.md)
trans-unit.target: To learn about creating templates, see [Authoring templates](./resource-group-authoring-templates.md)

trans-unit.source: To deploy the template you created, see [Deploying templates](azure-portal/resource-group-template-deploy.md)
trans-unit.target: To deploy the template you created, see [Deploying templates](azure-portal/resource-group-template-deploy.md)

trans-unit.source: To understand the functions you can use in a template, see [Template functions](./resource-group-template-functions.md)
trans-unit.target: To understand the functions you can use in a template, see [Template functions](./resource-group-template-functions.md)

trans-unit.source: For guidance on designing your templates, see [Best practices for designing Azure Resource Manager templates](best-practices-resource-manager-design-templates.md)
trans-unit.target: For guidance on designing your templates, see [Best practices for designing Azure Resource Manager templates](best-practices-resource-manager-design-templates.md)
